speaker: Viral image
vclaim: Nancy Belusi states that $2.4 billion in social security has been transferred to cover the costs of isolation."
date: stated on October 9, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, Nancy Belusi didn't transfer social security funds to investigate isolation.
text: The Speaker of the Council, Nancy Pelosi, recently attracted the anger of some Facebook users as they responded to a headline claiming that she was using social security funds to investigate isolation. "Pelosi transferred $2.4 billion from social security to cover the costs of isolation," reads the headline in the Facebook screen shot on October 9. A sign under the headline and above the picture of Pelosi says: "You can't allow it!" This address is posted on the Internet: putatriotsunite.com. "Leave our money alone," someone wrote in comments, calling Belauce an offensive name. "Stop there, you old thief," said another user. This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The distinguished fact-finding bloggers mentioned on January 10, 2021 in the story of "The Rebel Law - General Flynn will be appointed Vice-President." What is not clear from the article is that Potatriotsunite.com is a web site "for satisfaction, irony and ridicule," according to its logo. Wipe down the page where this fake story of Belusi appears and you will find "Copeight 1776-2906-Paed Liberal Trols of America." This article, marked as "the joy that makes you excited, the constant story of Nancy Belusi's fantasy alcohol addiction," quotes the speaker: "Well, most voters and Trump's supporters are retired older persons. I think it would be appropriate to ask them to help pay for their error. They only have to work without cable for one or two years. Okay? Now excuse me, I have to meet my alcohol boy." We looked for real news coverage for Belusi about social security money to investigate the dismissal, but it doesn't exist. We're assessing this Facebook mail pants on fire!
